text: Hi! We started out by installing a new theme (Atomic Free), cloning it, and then modifying it. Quite early on we realized that pretty much every component provided by the theme needs to be customized. Many attributes are not modifiable, even simple things like left-alignment of a text. We're now trying to figure out what the next best course of action is. Should we stick with themes or just build our own templates and modules incl. global modules to get by?

What are the advantages of using a theme really? We found out that we can't create our own drag-n-drop templates and include in them the menu (header) from the Atomic theme, even if it is a global module.
Would you advise to a) stop using themes altogether and just design everything ourself  b) refactor the Atomic theme using local dev tools, c) build a theme from scratch

Hi all,

Does anyone know a way to export just the URLs for landing pages created in HubSpot?
<@U01GZRY47DG> when you say test environment what are you refering to? Sandbox?
But yes, weâ€™ll use these test accounts as a sandbox and link it to our staging environment.
I think you can get links by creating a report of all landing pages.
hi y'all, I'm checking out HubSpot CMS after many years in the open source CMS world (Ibexa/eZ Publish, Drupal 7 & 8, and Wordpress)

Hi Sakari, I'd love to hear about what you decide to do after you review this!  I'm new to HubSpot CMS myself and wondering to what extent custom sites can take advantage of the drag & drop builder vs just have a bunch of coded templates!
